column4: hi all. any ideas why a kernel wont boot with no error output at all?
Too little information to suggest anything.
thats all i have :) i tried to build a custom kernel, but when i boot it, i get past grub then nothing
trying to install your own kernel?
i am, aye
any ideas on that error?
yes, I've seen it quite often, long long time ago when I first tried devfs.
i was thinking it might be something to do with ide support in the kernel
i don't have devfs in there
its in the submenu in filesystems, the same place where you can enable devfs.
yeah in pseudo filesystems. but it's not in the list
it's not showing up, which i think means it depends on something else which isn't enabled?
look for Virtual Memory File System (former shmfs)
not there either. i'm gonna restart the whole config process.
which kernel version are you trying to install?
Virtual memory file system in Pseudo File Systems in File systems.
yeah, i've looked up in the .config file where they are, but they're not showing up in a make xconfig
:) just starting out really. went for a job as linux tech support, but got a job as a developer
ditch xconfig, use menuconfig.
thanks for the help before, i think i'm almost there now :)
You're welcome. }:>
